wikipedia_page.main: Elliot Dee (born 7 March 1994) is a Welsh international rugby union player who plays for the Dragons regional team as a hooker having previously played for Bedwas RFC.

response: On 28 October, Elliot Dee withdrew from the squad due to injury, and was replaced by Kirby Myhill.
On 15 November, Kirby Myhill was withdrawn from the squad, while Elliot Dee returned to the squad following his recovery from injury.

Of the current players Ollie Griffiths, Leon Brown, Elliot Dee, Aaron Wainwright, Jonah Holmes, Ross Moriarty, Ben Carter, Taine Basham and Will Rowlands have featured in Wales test matches whilst with the region. Tavis Knoyle, Adam Warren, Richard Hibbard, Aaron Jarvis, Rhodri Williams, Sam Davies, Jamie Roberts and Dan Baker achieved Wales international caps before joining the Dragons as did Gonzalo Bertranou for Argentina.

Notable people to have grown up in Newbridge include, world-champion boxer Joe Calzaghe CBE; Kim Simmonds of Savoy Brown; Steve Strange, frontman of New Romantic band Visage; and Sir Terry Matthews OBE, high-tech entrepreneur and owner of the Celtic Manor Resort. British Lions and Welsh rugby union captain and coach John Dawes OBE is from Chapel-Of-Ease, near Newbridge. Elliot Dee who plays rugby for Wales was born and raised in Newbridge. The Town also hosts a world famous Brass Band Newbridge Celynen Band that over its time has been an award winning brass band and winning many competitions.

Current ex Penallta players who are thriving for higher placed clubs include Dai Flanagan (Cardiff Blues/Ospreys/Llanelli RFC), Gareth Davies (Wales 7s/ Cardiff Blues/Cardiff RFC), Steffan Jones (Dragons/Crosskeys RFC/Bedford Blues), Elliot Dee (Dragons), Scott Matthews (Dragons/Crosskeys RFC), Jack Condy (Scarlets), Arwel Robson (Newport RFC / Dragons), Ellis Shipp Dragons, Wales U20s) and Shaun Powell (Cardiff RFC).
